AdsOnDeliveryRestrictions.description: This setting allows the delivery restriction flags on SCTE-35 segmentation descriptors to determine whether a message signals an ad.  Choosing "NONE" means no SCTE-35 messages become ads.  Choosing "RESTRICTED" means SCTE-35 messages of the types specified in AdTriggers that contain delivery restrictions will be treated as ads.  Choosing "UNRESTRICTED" means SCTE-35 messages of the types specified in AdTriggers that do not contain delivery restrictions will be treated as ads.  Choosing "BOTH" means all SCTE-35 messages of the types specified in AdTriggers will be treated as ads.  Note that Splice Insert messages do not have these flags and are always treated as ads if specified in AdTriggers.

properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the secret in Secrets Manager that your Content Distribution Network (CDN) uses for authorization to access your endpoint.

CmafEncryption.description: A Common Media Application Format (CMAF) encryption configuration.

properties.name: ConstantInitializationVector
properties.description: An optional 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks. If you don't specify a value, then MediaPackage creates the constant initialization vector (IV).

type.description: An optional 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks. If you don't specify a value, then MediaPackage creates the constant initialization vector (IV).

properties.description: Time (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

type.description: Time (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

properties.description: A list of HLS manifest configurations

type.description: A list of HLS manifest configurations

properties.name: SegmentDurationSeconds
properties.description: Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

type.description: Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

properties.description: An optional custom string that is prepended to the name of each segment. If not specified, it defaults to the ChannelId.

DashPackage.description: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) packaging configuration.

properties.name: AdTriggers
properties.description: A list of SCTE-35 message types that are treated as ad markers in the output.  If empty, no ad markers are output.  Specify multiple items to create ad markers for all of the included message types.

type.description: A list of SCTE-35 message types that are treated as ad markers in the output.  If empty, no ad markers are output.  Specify multiple items to create ad markers for all of the included message types.

properties.name: IncludeIframeOnlyStream
properties.description: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

type.description: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

properties.name: ManifestLayout
properties.description: Determines the position of some tags in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to FULL, elements like SegmentTemplate and ContentProtection are included in each Representation.  When set to COMPACT, duplicate elements are combined and presented at the AdaptationSet level.

type.description: Determines the position of some tags in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to FULL, elements like SegmentTemplate and ContentProtection are included in each Representation.  When set to COMPACT, duplicate elements are combined and presented at the AdaptationSet level.

properties.name: ManifestWindowSeconds
properties.description: Time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.

type.description: Time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.

properties.name: MinBufferTimeSeconds
properties.description: Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.

type.description: Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.

properties.name: MinUpdatePeriodSeconds
properties.description: Minimum duration (in seconds) between potential changes to the Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD).

type.description: Minimum duration (in seconds) between potential changes to the Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD).

properties.name: PeriodTriggers
properties.description: A list of triggers that controls when the outgoing Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD) will be partitioned into multiple periods. If empty, the content will not be partitioned into more than one period. If the list contains "ADS", new periods will be created where the Channel source contains SCTE-35 ad markers.

type.description: A list of triggers that controls when the outgoing Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD) will be partitioned into multiple periods. If empty, the content will not be partitioned into more than one period. If the list contains "ADS", new periods will be created where the Channel source contains SCTE-35 ad markers.

properties.name: Profile
properties.description: The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type.  When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled.

type.description: The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type.  When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled.

properties.name: SegmentDurationSeconds
properties.description: Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

type.description: Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

properties.name: SegmentTemplateFormat
properties.description: Determines the type of SegmentTemplate included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to NUMBER_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.  When set to TIME_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Time$ media URLs. When set to NUMBER_WITH_DURATION, only a duration is included in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.

type.description: Determines the type of SegmentTemplate included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to NUMBER_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.  When set to TIME_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Time$ media URLs. When set to NUMBER_WITH_DURATION, only a duration is included in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.

properties.name: SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds
properties.description: Duration (in seconds) to delay live content before presentation.

type.description: Duration (in seconds) to delay live content before presentation.

properties.name: UtcTiming
properties.description: Determines the type of UTCTiming included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD)

type.description: Determines the type of UTCTiming included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD)

properties.name: UtcTimingUri
properties.description: Specifies the value attribute of the UTCTiming field when utcTiming is set to HTTP-ISO, HTTP-HEAD or HTTP-XSDATE

type.description: Specifies the value attribute of the UTCTiming field when utcTiming is set to HTTP-ISO, HTTP-HEAD or HTTP-XSDATE

properties.name: ConstantInitializationVector
properties.description: A constant initialization vector for encryption (optional). When not specified the initialization vector will be periodically rotated.

type.description: A constant initialization vector for encryption (optional). When not specified the initialization vector will be periodically rotated.

properties.name: EncryptionMethod
properties.description: The encryption method to use.

type.description: The encryption method to use.

properties.name: KeyRotationIntervalSeconds
properties.description: Interval (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

type.description: Interval (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

properties.name: RepeatExtXKey
properties.description: When enabled, the EXT-X-KEY tag will be repeated in output manifests.

type.description: When enabled, the EXT-X-KEY tag will be repeated in output manifests.

HlsManifest.description: A HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

properties.name: AdMarkers
properties.description: This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint. "NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output. "PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest. "SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35 messages in the input source. "DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value that is greater than 0.

type.description: This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint. "NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output. "PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest. "SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35 messages in the input source. "DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value that is greater than 0.

properties.name: AdTriggers
properties.description: A list of SCTE-35 message types that are treated as ad markers in the output.  If empty, no ad markers are output.  Specify multiple items to create ad markers for all of the included message types.

type.description: A list of SCTE-35 message types that are treated as ad markers in the output.  If empty, no ad markers are output.  Specify multiple items to create ad markers for all of the included message types.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: The ID of the manifest. The ID must be unique within the OriginEndpoint and it cannot be changed after it is created.

type.description: The ID of the manifest. The ID must be unique within the OriginEndpoint and it cannot be changed after it is created.

properties.name: IncludeIframeOnlyStream
properties.description: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

type.description: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

properties.name: ManifestName
properties.description: An optional short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL. If not specified, defaults to the manifestName for the OriginEndpoint.

type.description: An optional short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL. If not specified, defaults to the manifestName for the OriginEndpoint.

properties.name: PlaylistType
properties.description: The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type. When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE entry will be included in the media playlist.

type.description: The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type. When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE entry will be included in the media playlist.

properties.name: PlaylistWindowSeconds
properties.description: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.

type.description: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.

properties.name: ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds
properties.description: The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the ingest time of the content. If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input, it will be passed through to HLS output.

type.description: The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the ingest time of the content. If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input, it will be passed through to HLS output.

properties.name: Url
properties.description: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.

type.description: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.

"DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value that is greater than 0.

If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input, it will be passed through to HLS output.

properties.name: Origination
properties.description: Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination

type.description: Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination

properties.description: Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback. If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.
